author: Taenil Auxifur

text: Because there was very little the SNES could do graphically, so video games had to be immersive in storytelling. They had to be catchy enough to stay in your mind long after you played them, but also interesting enough to actually pull you in in the first place.  And, for the price, they had to be of such quality that players would feel like they got the right bang for their buck. Hence, the wide use of immersive, story-driven RPGs that are still memorable to this day.
author: Alexander Shackles

text: I think if anyone loves this version, they'll find the DS version of this (the music, not so much the game) both from the game itself, and then it's arranged version.  You'll probably see it on the side bar to your right.
author: Rusa

text: Because if Snes shitty processor (it's fact!),and a powerful sound chip,developers had no choice but to make RPGs. Not all developers could program shmups and action games for it, because the action slows down to the Snes' inability to handle too many sprites on screen. Look at Gradius 3 and Castlevania 4.RPGs didn't require developers to show large number of sprites on screen. They were confined to RPGS for most of the time. For the record Snes processor was 3.58 mhz and Genesis was  7.67 mhz.

author: garrywarne1

text:
@Arc13

1. SNES had limited graphical capability, so they were able to focus more on story. Making RPG was the best excuse for a developer to craft a big, old, open-ended medieval story out of it.

2. The battle systems were easy to craft, since it's a text-based adventure with fancy sprites. Hardware-demanding real-time processes found in adventure and fps games were of little worry for this genre.

3. Final Fantasy for the NES/MSX motivated competition, and SNES was the chanced battleground.

text:
My brother bought the SNES with this game together(one package) back in '92. This game never got the respect that it deserved imo. This one actually set the tone a bit with really hard puzzles(Mountain of No Return, Worlds most Difficult Trick*cough*). Even if people can do these easily now, when I was only 7; it took FOREVER to complete this game. It was that hard.

Still, amazing for its time.
